review: Updated update: PLEASE NOTE THEY HAVE CHANGED THE FRIES BACK!! I am certain this must be due to the hysteria caused when the masses decried the total brain-fart of a decision to try new fries. (Or, maybe the Robin reads Yelp, ha ha.) All is well; everyone back in the pool. This has been a public service announcement.

I have always gone to Red Robin on a regular basis for years but stopped going because I felt it is over priced burgers.  Well I saw the sale on the burgers for 6.99 so we decided to give it a try again.  Well I am sure you can tell from my one star that is horrible.  The appetizer was cold and tasteless.  The burgers we got we not good at all.  I got whiskey BBQ - the onions we not good at all, the lettuce was stale.  3.99 for lemonade, why? We were disappointed and will not go back for a very long time.  The service was excellent but it was not her fault so got a good tip. Should have ordered the Banzai burger and no app or lemonade.

I've been to Red Robin's many times over the years.  Love their french fries! And they are bottomless!  They also have tasty adult beverages, I really enjoy the Sand in the Shorts! The one major thing I am disappointed with, is that for a place that has an extensive burger menu, they have one veggie option for a burger.  The trademark Garden Burger is so mediocre.  For a place that has all sorts of gourmet burgers, why can't they have a house made vegetarian burger??  Or a portabello mushroom burger?? :(  Paying $8 for a mediocre vegetarian burger was a real let down!

ok. I recently went back to this location after many years and changed my mind on it. Yes, it is overprised but  I would say the bottomless strawberry lemonade is fairly a good deal. The lemonade comes in a fashionable glass with real strawberry pieces in and it's pretty to look at as well.

I have visited Red Robins several times. They have  bottomless french fries (steak fries) and a mean Mountain High dessert. Two of us can share one easily. I feel their prices are a little on the hefty side though. I don't eat hamburgers anymore but there is still a variety of other things to try. The atmosphere is quite kid friendly I think. They sing their own rendition of Happy Birthday.  Our server, this visit, was pleasant enough but took quite a while to come back and check on us. I was ready for my fries pretty quickly because the Prime Rib french dip was lacking. He would have noticed that if he came by. It was loaded with fat (which I removed before eating) and tasteless. Hence the extra fries.  I probably would only visit a Red Robin again if the majority ruled. I would probably get something beefless too.
Quality food and good service is always what you get here.  Nothing fancy but something for everyone on the menu and in the bar

I almost gave this 4 stars, but it's Red Robin. Other than the bottomless steak fries and seasoned salt- what is it? The chicken strips are good, not great, the fish is good, not great, the salad is good not great, the burgers are good--- but not great.... What Red Robin does well is give you a predictable, and quick lunch or dinner. It does nothing exceedingly well.  This location does offer a great patio with tree cover and a view of a fountain pond. The service is good, but not great. But hell, I'll take a refill of those fries and dump some season salt on them. Mmmmmm, that was good--- but not great.

Honestly, I have to say I've been going to this Red Robin for years and have been rarely disappointed.  It is worth noting that I get the bacon cheeseburger every time (with some pink) and find it just as good as every other time. The other day I decided to go for the healthier option and had a lettuce wrapped, chicken burger and it wasn't quite as good, but still pretty decent.  And for those onion rings lovers out there - you can order those instead of fries for no additional charge!  All I'd really recommend here are the burgers, they're actually really good.

Red Robin is hit or miss.  Sometimes you get a great server other times its clear you don't want to be there. We typically hit up RR when we are wanting to go to a movie.  Last time we went there was a fun raiser for the special Olympics and it was crawling with cops and kids and it was a fun time. Food is pretty much consistent -- love the French onion soup, and it always comes out piping hot. Our food always comes out quickly and its hot.  And this place doesn't seem like you'd have to be afraid to send your food back, they do listen to what you say. We come back a lot:)

Red Robin is one of them burger places I always enjoy.. although it seems like I like its garlic fries with Red Robin's signature honey mustard sauce than any of the burgers. I would rather have one of their appetizers instead. I have nothing against their burgers - in fact, I think they are pretty darn good - but I'm not so big on burgers anymore... trying to eat healthier here :D Anyway, Red Robin is as steady as any great burger/restaurant goes. It never failed me and provides above-average service. The only reasons why Red Robin gets 3 stars instead of 4 are that its menu is bit boring and the quality of food is OK at best. :) But Red Robin, I still enjoy your company!

Another Red Robin.  Met the family here for a dinner. OK, I'm thinking that they need to change their methods here.  I think that the burgers are precooked and barely heated up before they serve them.  Come on, the cheese isn't even melted.  Experienced that at a few Red Robins now.  The soup is super hot and the Fries can absolutely scorch your mouth.  Let's get the burgers up to temp too please. And while I'm thinking about it.  Is it really worth about $10 for these burgers?  Come on, they're just burgers.  I can see it for the other dishes.  And salad and soup.  It's becoming a bit overpriced for quality and items served in my opinion.  If it weren't for the kids, I'm not sure I'd be going there.

Red Robin is a hit or miss these days. I used to always go to Red Robin by Washington Square and I have never had an issue with their service or food. I have been to a few others in the area...Tanasbourne, Wilsonville and few others and they have almost always disappointed me!  Red Robin in Tanasbourne was a miss on our my most recent visit! The waitress was wonderful and attentive, but the burgers and fries were lukewarm and my burger was not completely made, it was missing a few ingredients.  Once I complained, OF COURSE, I got what I ordered and everything was nice and hot!  I should have gone to Five guys!

Red Robin has never been great of course, but I think they've really gone downhill. The food quality is not where it used to be. They seem to be cost cutting. This location does not even have Tabasco Sauce anymore. They only carry Cholula hot sauce. Yuck. Even my kids no longer want to go there.

This location hasn't been updated yet, and I sort of liked the old look compared to the new look of the one located near my home. Service was spot-on. Great fried cheese and my burger was just the way I liked it. We also ordered a kids meal (grilled cheese with apples) and it looked very good and sooper cheesy! Fun place for kids and great bar for the adults (well, the servers bring the drinks from there!).
Western BBQ Burger is my favorite!  Could use extra bbq sauce.

I used to go here pretty frequently - signed up for the loyalty program and went in for a birthday burger - everything was great till they brought back my cars and hasn't taken her burger off - they went on about how our card wasn't activated - seemed strange considering how else would we have gotten the coupon? The manager outright refused to honor the discount stating it was run by an outside company they always have problems with. I complained through the phone line and requested contact but they never called. Between this the dull food and overpriced drinks I was just done, there are too many good restaurants in the area to waste money on this place.

Your usual Red Robin. I do love the bottomless fries....  The speckled lemonade is pretty good. All the burgers are decent. My usual is the cod sandwich or whiskey river BBQ with either beef or chicken.

Red Robin, as others have said is hit or miss.  I guess it depends on who is cooking.  The last time I went I had the Banzai burger.  Sometimes I have the chicken wrap.  This time the food was very good and the service was great.  I am without children, so I usually eat in the bar, and that is very pleasant.  I will go back again and again.  It is close, and usually quite good.

Red Robin's food is very good.  I love the Ensenada chicken platter, very good and tasty one of my favorites.  My favorite burger is the Guacamole bacon cheeseburger.  I love the bottomless fries!  There is a 50/50 chance.  If you go on a good day, the host/hostess will be very friendly and the waiter/waitress will take care of you good.  If you go on a bad day, I had the host/hostess be rude to us and the waitress forget about us.  But the manager did come to apologize for her behavior.  Even though it doesn't happen too often.  The one in Beaverton is much better but much farther from my house.  Whenever I can, I rather go over there.  I will continue to go there for the food.

This isn't my first choice to eat when shopping in the " big city", but when you give your granddaughter a choice to celebrate kindergarten graduation and she picks RR, what's a grandparent to do?!? ( yes I threw out other choices, but she remained firm in her choice) We arrived at 11:30 and it wasn't too busy. We ordered our drinks; a couple bar drinks, kiddie drinks and watermelon lemonade. Everything but the bar drinks arrived.. 5 minutes later we reminded our server and we watched as she went to the bar to place our order.. What?!? I could understand if the place was slammed but it wasn't... The watermelon drink was returned ( awful, awful nasty!) and a cola drink was returned before the bar drinks...we ordered our meal before the drinks arrived.. Finally we could toast a successful accomplishment, and the anticipation of many more! Before our meals arrived and drinks drank  the server was flagged for another round.. Good thing, they arrived halfway through the meal. The Banzai burger was yummy, lots of pineapple and teriyaki sauce. The chop burger tasted like a steak burger( not as good as my ground beef I make) and the kids liked the fries and barely ate their own meals. As for the endless fries.... They must be endless as in supply for the restaurant because our sever never came by, except to deliver and pick- up the check.  Manager? Never saw one...This type of service is typical on the coast.. Maybe our server was from the north coast....?!? Or the attitudes are slowly creeping east, like an obnoxious weed....Three stars for food minus one star for service leaves two stars... And a tip far larger than our server deserved...

I'm a Red Robin frequent-buyer. I love their burgers and salads. I have never had worse service than at this location. I ordered two salads to go and when I arrived to pick them up I stood at the bar and made eye contact with THREE servers, including the bartender. They immediately looked away and went about what they were doing without even acknowledging me. I would understand if the restaurant was busy, but there was one other gentleman in the bar. I continued to wait and finally one of them rudely asked if I had "been helped yet" and I replied no. Then she said "what do you need" and I said I was waiting to pick up an order. I was then handed the ticket and when I asked to split tender they acted as if I was inconveniencing them. She then put the bag on the counter and walked away. I wasn't asked if I needed anything else (silverware, napkins, etc.) I'm not one to complain but I really feel that they are lacking in customer service. I don't see myself visiting this location in the near future, I'll drive the extra 2 miles to be treated better.

The last time i visited a Red Robin was about 4 years ago. First of all, either it was this location or WOW, they have changed..and not for the better. The Menu's had a different look, but the actual food stayed the same. I usually go for the California Chicken Burger, so ordered that during my last visit. What happened to the basket with fries and a burger??? My meal was served on a damn plate and the fries were shoved into a silver looking object/fries holder, similar to the Cheesecake Factory. The problem is, RR will never be anything different than a place to go for burgers and fries, so it should probably stop trying so hard.  The fries are the bomb. Especially with the seasoning and some of their ranch sauce.  Did you know you can order a basket of fries the same time you order drinks and they will bring you some, free of charge? Yep, naughty little secret right there.

I'm torn on this one. I love the food, but I keep having terrible service experiences at this location. I usually come here with a couple of my coworkers. I always get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger which is topped with *swoon* crispy onion straws. Additionally, you pretty much have to get their fries. They are amazing. Also, when I went there most recently, they had redone their menu, and they offered a large selection of new sauces to dip your fries in. Ranch is my classic favorite, but I had a Thai Chili sauce that was delicious, and I will definitely get it again. Some of the new "fancier" sauces have a small fee, but they give you a large portion to make up for the added charge.  Red Robin keeps it simple with "a little pink" or "no pink" as your burger options. I'm a well-done kinda gal, so I don't have an issue with this, but all those "medium rare" burger / steak people might have some beef (pun!) with this.  I come here pretty frequently and sometimes the wait staff is ok, but I have had my order forgotten / waited for someone to acknowledge my table for 20 minutes / took forever to get the bill / etc. multiple times, so I don't feel guilty docking my rating as it definitely isn't a one-time issue.  Regardless, I love the food, so I will be back. I do wish that they would work with their wait staff to provide an overall better service experience.

My work group likes to go here when we have a team-sponsored lunch. The service is pretty spot on and when we order 11 different drinks and 11 different meals, we've never had any mess ups.  That's quite relaxing when people don't need to worry getting what they ordered.  And we have gluten-free, vegetarian, and other restricted diet people. Last time I tried their spicy burger and it was actually very tasty!  breaded fried jalapeno is just the right thing to make a burger good.

For a chain the burgers are pretty good. When in season, the Oktoberfest burger is my favourite. But what many people don't realize is that their chicken burgers are the best in town (especially the teriyaki chicken). Another so called "hidden item" is the crispy artic cod burger is just delicious.
Thank you to our server, Denice for an awesome lunch! Quick, polite, efficient service got us in and out in 45 minutes. The woman knows her stuff!
Great waitress. Nice enough to make sure the Huskies game was on.

Red Robin... Many varieties of burgers, hip trendy setting, TVs everywhere.  The tavern double is their answer to the big Mac with three separate options to customize, from bacon to mild heat to high heat.  The endless fries are great, if you are really hungry, ask your server for a refill as soon as you place your order and voila, free appetizer.   This joint lives up to the promise.  The place is clean and comfortable, the food comes quickly just as we ordered.  The peach tea is done well and is my go to beverage.  When you want a good, overpriced hamburger with all the possible combinations served with a smile and a full bar to provide the adult beverages we ask for, this is always a safe bet.

Seems like they've changed, and not for the better. The burgers used to come half wrapped in paper, so all the stuff didn't fall out all over you when you tried to take a bite. Not so anymore and the fries came in some stupid oversized napkin ring so they don't have to give you very many. The artichoke dip doesn't come with bread like it used to and my plate was somewhat grubby. Disappointing.

The food is consistently decent, the prices are decent, and the waitstaff is decent. So all in all while not awesome, also not horrible. Just decent. This is my kiddos favorite place to eat so we come here a lot. And the rewards card has come in handy.

The burgers used to be a lot bigger than they are now, but I still like them. The fries are my favorite part, and I end up eating those more than my burger. I'm the sort that goes there expecting very specific things and I get it. I expect service not to be the best thing ever, the food to be a greasy mess slathered in fatty goodness, and to not have a decent conversation because of the noise. Basically get what I expect every time and have no complaints.

Couldn't figure out how to separate the chili con queso to 'chili' and 'queso' for the vegetarian/carnivore mixed family, like every other Red Robin does.  Then proceeded to send over manager full and attitude,which obviously made things so much better. I will not be back.
Great food, BUT always, ALWAYS packed to the rim with people. Too loud inside, and too small.

I normally am a fan of this place and location specifically. Today was not a day for that. Out for errands, I thought I would stop here for lunch. I normally sit at the bar as I did today. Was greeted by host and was given a menu and silverware. Was really a good start. Sat at bar, bartender not seen but bar waitress saw he, smiles and walked to her table. 1...2...5...10 minutes. No one comes over, sees me, wants to see me? I left...again only bad experience here, but when you open...show your open...

Burger is fine.  A1 Peppercorn have onion bitses.  Salad is limp.  I send back, wave hand in air.  I pouting like a Gremlin.  HUMPH!  Okay, say this man.  We take.  You no pay it.  Is good.  Friends?  Yes.  I thanking him, who sound like nighttime DJ voice.  Very good, this burger.  Steak fry will make you fill, so eat of it until to bursting.  No, ha, ha!  I make jest.  But really, avoid salad if dressings you like.  Limp leaf comes loose in your finger like a night of too much drinking.  Is best to "quit when ahead." no?

This Ted Robin has the best service and is far cleaner than the Beaverton location. It all starts with management and The tanasbourne managers are very involved, you hardly see the Beaverton managers. Next time you visit ask for Billie he is the best .

Usually very solid restaurant.  Love the bottomless strawberry lemonade and fries. It all depends on the server you get, very rarely do I get poor service. Location overall is very clean, sometimes the tables are sticky and if you tell the server they will wipe it down for you.

What is with all the Red Robins and their subpar service? The servers are nice and friendly. Every one of them. I feel like they're flaky though. All of them. At least in all of my experiences at all of the Red Robins I have been to in the last year or two.  I write of this particular one because my experience here has made me come to the conclusion that the customer service sucks all around and I hate to say that because once upon a time, I really did enjoy coming to Red Robin. We were a party of four, here for dinner after a movie. Mom-in-law offered to pay for dinner since we paid for the movies. I asked for a booth where we can watch the Spurs game. So far so good, we got a good seat. Our server was nice and friendly. We ordered our drinks. They were served quickly and we even got our strawberry lemonades refilled quickly and without having to ask. Bonus points because this was a first for us. At this point, I'm thinking "Awesome, could it be that we finally found a Red Robin that's on point?" And then it south from there. When the food finally arrives, I don't get my roasted green chile dip and one of the strawberry lemonades needs to be refilled.  When asked if there was anything else she could bring us (she wasn't our server), I said "Napkins, please. I also ordered a roasted green chile dip. Not honey mustard."  "Oh, I'll bring it out," she replies.  You can probably guess what happened next. She never came back. Our server came back but go figure that it was when my mouth was full and she didn't stick around long enough for me to force it down. The strawberry lemonade didn't get refilled either. She went MIA after that. We could hear her but we didn't see her.  We flagged down another server instead to ask for more fries. Several minutes past, my meal is nearly done and our server appears to check on us again.  She swoops to take our kiddo's plate off the table but I stop her. "He's waiting for fries," I tell her. "Oh, I'll get that started," she says ever so helpful.  "I put the order in for you already," the other server shouts from over the wall where the drink station is.  "I'll go check on it," she says brightly.  Several minutes go by, fries were super fried.  He didn't even finish it and this growing boy loves his fries.  When we get the check, she quickly took care of the discrepancy we found on the bill. (Took off the roasted green chile dip that I never got) It was smooth sailing thereafter. We finished in time to watch the Spurs beat the Thunders in OT for the Western Conference Finals. The meal itself was okay. Mom-in-law devoured her burger.  She really enjoyed the DGB.  The strawberry lemonades are delicious. The staff is nice but need more focus and how about some follow through. The food is consistent however after this time, I don't think even the bottomless steak fries will tempt me back.
It's red robin.....it has never disappointed me yet. Very consistent, you know what your getting when you come here. Above average burger and bottomless fries. Solid.

We have been Red Robin customers for many years...before we had children. This location off of Hwy 26 and 185th in Beaverton is our favorite. Our daughter loves the Clucks n Fries. We also are fans of the Banzai, Blue Ribbon, Wiskey River BBQ Chicken Wrap with a side of Chipotle Mayo...OMG!, Strawberry Lemonade, and their Honey Mustard is the best...wish I could buy it at the grocery store. They do simple things for their customers to make dining out easier. For young kids, bendy straws so when they are sitting, they don't tip their cups over. Since finding out my son has a gluten allergy back a few years ago, we've had to find options to go out to eat. RR has been at the forefront to be sensitive to allergen customers. They have gluten free buns and will cook fries in a separate fryer that haven't touched breaded foods. We never asked them to do this, they just did their homework and made this adjustment for all the many allergic people of the world. I am happy that not putting silverware at the table makes it better to not have to wash unused silverware over and over just for using the napkins. One thing I would like to see is the servers bring lots of napkins every time. We usually have to ask and remind to get some. Your burgers are juicy and delicious and that gets on the hands frequently. So Red Robin gets double points from us and we can continue to be loyal Red Robin supporters.

This location has great service.  The food comes out as ordered and the service is prompt. Our waitress was knowledgeable, friendly, and enthusiastic.  I highly recommend this location as opposed to the TV Hwy (Hillsboro) location as their service is consistently bad.

Usually we love Red Robin! This was our first experience at this location to celebrate my husband's birthday. We had our two kids with us and brought in a platter of cupcakes. There are a number of things that made this the worst dining experience we have had in a long time.  1. Drink refills were not offered. We asked for one and then three other drinks became empty and we were not offered refills until we were paying at which point it was too late.  2. We had cupcakes with us in the middle of the table on a platter...easily seen. No mention of "oh are we celebrating something?" So we quietly sang as a table and ate our cupcakes off the table instead of asking our server for small plates since when we asked for more napkins a second time they were never brought to us.  3. The fries were way over salted and my wrap was totally dry.  I'm not even mentioning the servers name because if he was over sat at the time then it's not entirely his fault (and the quality of food is not his fault)  We will not return to the location again.

My experience was pleasant. Waiter was very nice and attentive. I got the freckled strawberry lemonade. Love the fun glass it comes in!! Ordered onion rings for appetizers and a tavern burger. All in all it was great! Comes with strawberry lemonade refills and bottomless fried. How could you go wrong?!

(UPDATE)  I was contacted via email by someone ostensibly from Red Robin; she said that "....it's obvious we missed the mark here.   Please contact me privately so we can make this right." Uh.  Like; no, Beavis.   (If she'd read my review, she'd know that the time to 'make things right' is *when the customer is there* - it's a day late and a dollar short after they've already been treated to what passes for customer service.    Again - most people won't complain.   They'll make a mental note that 'this place sucks green bananas', and find someplace else.  Sorta like me.   So no, there's no 'making this right'. Learn; and move on, folks....)

If you've seen one Red Robin, you've seen them all.   This location offers the same burgers, with the same flavors as any other RR.  Our group ordered the burgers with varying preferences in done-ness and we didn't all get what we ordered, but that's usually to be expected.  The only reason I chose to write a review for this one, however, was the subpar service we received.  Though our server was friendly when she was present, she was rarely around.  I had to track her down for water, drink refills, extra fries/sauce/napkins...and with each time we tracked her down, she was already walking away before I finished talking.  And to make matters worse, we had to as her multiple times because she often forgot to come back.  If the establishment had been busy I would have understood but she was standing around talking to other servers around the drink stand, which we had a direct view of.  Completely unacceptable      Next time I'm in the area, I'll definitely consider eating somewhere else.

I have to update my review because I have continued to visit this location over the last year or two and have not had any other issues.  Additionally, someone from the corporate office reached out to me regarding my complaint shortly after I posted my original review and sent me a gift card patch things over. It must have just been a bad night for the manager and/or server.

Typically red robin. I always enjoy it as far as a chain burger place goes. I love the fries with ranch. The burgers are always appetizing. I enjoy the creative drinks as well. Our waitress was super nice and friendly. I will most likely be back when craving a yummy burger, especially since this location is just around the corner from my house.

Use to love this restaurant since I was a kid but damn have they gone downhill. The last two times I've been here have been the worse experiences I've had eating out. I ate undercooked chicken from their burger and got food poisoning. Last time I went in I got a salad to be safe and chipped my tooth on a pebble in my salad.... NO EXCUSE for having something that hard in my salad. I also got the pretzel bites that were burnt and the cheese dip wasn't even cheese. Never coming back, my friends agree.

Oh burger... I wanted you to be the best (order blue ribbon, no tom and a SOFT EGG) yum... The egg was hard, I hate hard eggs so they brought me a slightly undercooked soft fried egg, I'll take it. Threw it in and it was...ok. Everything was cold at that point even though the flavor potential was there. Oh well. The new roasted garlic dipping sauce tasted like a warm creamy aioli, that was tasty. Not off the radar for ever, but I'm good for now. Beer (Widner) top notch!

Pretty similar to other red robins... My go to order is the bbq chicken wrap. It was still yummy but seemed much smaller than usual. We tried an Oreo milkshake, the oreos on top were stale and the ice cream tasted fake. The few fries we got with our meal were stale. We asked one server for more who forgot and so we asked another but we when got the fries finally they also weren't great. I'm disappointed because red Robin is a favorite of ours, hopefully we just got unlucky today. I will say our server was friendly and good at checking in!

Second time I have dined at this location.......still waiting for my Burger for over 50 minutes.........  people sat before me and my wife are almost finishing their meal. To me this is unacceptable. I will give Red Robyn one more chance for all those years we have been together. I am giving 4 stars because my waiter and his managrr just apologized and paid for the food.

So.  We have returned here a few times the last few months because it was simple and close by.  They have been hard at work renovating their look.  And changing the menu. The service has been rather hit and miss if I'm honest.  My wife has noticed that when busy the greeting staff tend to show some inexperience.  Often getting flustered and looking visibly irritated, wether with their job or the customers I'm not sure. I have attempted to try the new "upmarket" angus burgers.  Each time, no matter the attempted flavor pairings, peppercorn or black and blue, I am less than impressed.  The same odd flavor of wet meat comes in each time.  Like the grill was recently scrubbed clean and then wiped with a wet rag making the burger itself taste soggy, and a bit gross.   So I have stuck with the regular burgers, and again have been hit and miss.  Lately they have been over cooked.  But still tasty.  The fries have often been cold and limp, rather disappointing.  The new apps are good.  The "premium" dipping sauces are ok, but I wasn't impressed enough to order any of them more than once and pay for them.   I'd give an extra half star if possible, but it isn't.  I'm wondering if going more upscale the chain hasent lost it's way on what made it good.  Simple good burgers, good service, and plenty of bar selection.  I'm all for change, but we have been left with the question lately if we should start hitting the nearby 5 guys.

My wife and I brought out teenage son and his girlfriend here on a Friday afternoon. The restaurant was busy, but the attentive and welcoming staff found us a table quickly. First noticed was the totally new decor. The restaurant has updated to more of a sports bar motif, but I was amazed to see so many young children - which says something is right. Waitresses were friendly, food was accurately prepared, attractively presented, and most important, the food was delicious. Two hamburgers, a very meaty and spicy chili, and a BLT were absolutely delicious. The peach milkshake could only be improved with pieces of fruit in it. Disappointed with the Red Robin app, but that has no bearing on the restaurant, service, or food.

2 & 1/2 hours for burgers for 6.  Had to ask more than once for everything.  Had to ask for drinks, sauce, silverware and napkins.  Horrible service. I did notice the waitresses had tables all over the restaurant.  :-/

First time I thought Red Robin really missed it. Food came out incorrect and replacement food came out after everyone had finished. Couldn't get a drink refill. I will avoid this location in the future.

I was terribly disappointed. The waitress at the bar area was rude, ordered us the wrong food and gave us a dirty look when we pointed it out! She even took my plate away before I was finished! Finally, we just put cash on the table and left. I will not return to this location.

My husband took out hamburgers and fish and chips yesterday.  My hamburgere was terrible which was mushroom and blue cheese in it.  It was $14, but it was the worst hamburger I've have ever had.  My husband asked well-done for beef patty, but It was not well-done but well-burned.  The surface was black, burned, and impossible to bite.  The patty was thin for $14 hamburger.  How do you sell this burned and hardened patty to people?  Even with $14 collars?  It tastes like Hard Bitter Ash kind of thing.  Well-done doesn't mean to make it black, burned, and impossible to bite.  It was a horrible experience and the worst hamburger ever in my life.  I had some good experience at Red Robins before, but I'll not go back any more and spread the word to my friends.  Be honest what you make!  Please sell the food that you can eat!  Then other people can eat too!

Terribly long wait times for food and drinks. Bottomless fries were never refilled, not enough sauces  brought out for them. Sweet potato fries came out ice cold. Sauce I ordered with dinner didn't come with dinner. Very long wait for replacement fries. Server was friendly but fake. He was apologetic but made no attempt to discount or make amends. This is why I do not go to Red Robin. The only reason we came was a friends birthday.

Ordered the cod fish and chips with unlimited fries and drink. The place was crazy busy at lunch and our server did not offer refills. I mentioned this to the server who apologized and gave me a to go bag. Management might consider extra support staff to help the core servers out. Fish was crispy but too greasy for my taste.

Me and my boyfriend come here occasionally and it always meets our expectations. I always get the Teriyaki Chicken burger and the chicken is always so delicious and moist. The last time we came in, the service was "eh" not outstanding but the food was great.

I used to come to this location all the time when I lived in Hillsboro.  Now that I only get out here once in a while, I was excited that there were gluten free buns available. Twice I've tried my veggie burger with the gluten free bun - twice I've been disappointed.  First time, there was plastic still stuck to the bun, and second time it was hard as a rock.  Really guys, either toast the buns, or try a different vendor - they do NOT have to be crumbly, and dry if they're gluten-free (not any more). Bottomless fries - always a plus. I usually come alone, so they usually stick me in the bar - and usually they are SLAMMED there at lunch.  So, even when I'm in a hurry, it does take more time than I expect to get my bill to pay and leave.  They take orders quickly, food comes pretty quickly, and then I wait and wait for an iced tea refill, as well as my bill.  It's pretty off-putting, but looking for a decent veggie burger with great fries - I just suck it up.

We occasionally eat at Red Robin and yesterday was one of those days.  We went at around 4:00p.  The service was good, the waitperson was attentive but my hamburger was dry, overcooked and tasteless.  The burger tasted like it was pre-cooked, then warmed in the microwave.  I just wanted a good burger.  I could get the same if not better at fast food. I guess, if I want a good burger, I'll go to Five Guys.

Food menu is better than before. The food varies, but the service is pretty good. I like the new wedge salad. They could use more blue cheese crumbles on the salad. I like how the restaurant has a new clean and slick look to it. My favorite burger is the burger with the egg on it. My go to is the bbq wrap or clucks and fries :)

I really don't even want to give two stars but our server was amazing and very polite, his name was Andres. So the reason I want to only give one star is because my husband was givin a raw hamburger. And about eating half of it I stopped him and called the server over. I understand mistakes happen but we both ordered hamburgers and mine was cooked medium/done and his was raw... Seems weird to me. Also the manager was very careless. He did not charge for the hamburger and I wouldn't have paid for it either way! It was disgusting. But he also did not take blame... He said it looks like they accidentally traded your for a sub pink burger... Not sure what that means... We will not be going back to this location. Too bad because Andres was great!

Absolutely terrible food and service.  My friend and I went out to dinner here last weekend, and it didn't even start off on a good note. It took our waitress so long to show up and ask us what we wanted to drink that we ended up placing our entire order because we weren't sure she'd ever come back. I got the Absolutely Absolut lemonade, which was definitely not as cold as it should have been and the strawberries didn't seem ripe enough, which made the entire drink taste really bitter.  We ordered the pretzel bites, which showed up with almost NO salt (making them super bland), and the cheese dipping was watery and disgusting.  My friend ordered the Seafood Scatter and I got a patty melt. Despite ordering my patty melt plain, it showed up with onions all over it. Both of our meals were cold, his fish was hard as a rock and not at all fresh, and the bread on my patty melt was basically burned and the meat was way overcooked.  We sent the food back and when they finally brought us more, it was obvious they'd taken the shrimp off of my friend's first plate and tossed it on the new one, because it was still hard and cold. As for my new patty melt, the bread was still almost burned, meat was overcooked, and to top things off, it had a really strange odor to it that caused me to give up a few bites in.  When the waitress finally brought us our check, we were informed that we'd been given the pretzel bites for free to make up for the trouble. However, considering the fries were the only edible thing we were served, it was really just too little, too late.  Wouldn't go back unless someone paid me a lot of money to suffer through their terrible food again.

Came in for National Burger Day. Unfortunately, they werent doing anything for it. But we had a really great waiter. He was very kind and was really on top of refilling our water and fries. Good atmosphere.

Our server Brian was awesome. Family of 5, 3 kids, showed up for a late dinner.  He was fast, accurate, and didn't try to upsell when I asked for water.  He did forget crayons for the kids but the food came out fast enough that kids didn't even remember.  He got the side orders right and refilled my husbands strawberry lemonade. Appreciate good service like this since it's becoming rare when we go out with kids!
My daughter loves this place! It helps a great deal when the waitstaff, Courtney, is so friendly and prompt. Thanks for making our meal perfect!

What a massive disappointment!  I hadn't eaten at a Red Robin in quite a few years because the last time was less than good!    On a whim we decided to get some food to go. A Monday night would  give us hope that it might not be a bad experience!  WRONG !!!!    The Big Tavern should be the Big turd! With nasty processed cheese.  Just because it's ordered with no pink doesn't mean it should look / taste like a turd puck!  What happened to iceberg lettuce ? Nobody wants yuppy lettuce that wilts on a burger!   I ordered a crispy chicken salad!  Ridiculous that they've completely removed the half order with a cup of soup. The to go waitress Shellie almost seemed pissed when I asked.  Oh here's an idea,  don't use yesterday's chicken on today's salad. Your not fooling anyone!  Substituting cucumber for hard boiled egg isn't going to make anyone happy.   Finally,  the fries.  If your going to use season salt on your fries it might be wise to show the fry guy it shouldn't turn the fries red from heavy over salting!   Your re model should be focused on your menu and food! Not little cutsie burger shaped seats while waiting for food to go!

Reviewing this location specifically. We are RR fans and we're stopping at the area's best reviewed location. We stopped for lunch for 3 adults and 2 children. They were fast to seat us. Our waitress willingly got the kids' orders started while we waited for one of the adults who was meeting us there. Their kids menu is great, with lots of kid-friendly options. They worked around food preferences and sensitivities knowledgeably, as we have come to expect from RR restaurants. Our waitress did this with a smile and asked clarifying questions to make sure it was fitting our needs.  Even during a busy lunch service she refilled drinks and the bottomless fries. The food was cooked well and salad ingredients were crisp and fresh. The actual food quantity seems to have gone down recently at RR in general but still plenty to satisfy our appetites. Overall we were pleased by their consistency.
Took 45 minutes to get silverware and three of the four dinners were ice cold.  Server seemed irritated with us even asking for a second round of fries.  Very disappointing experience.

Surprisingly excellent food! Husband had a "southern something" burger that was so good! My Whiskey BBQ chicken wrap was totally delicious. Broccoli is uneventful: don't bother. Otherwise, fantastic choice for dinner.

RR is one of our family favorites and the store located at 185th and Evergreen in Hillsboro OR is our go to location. I am shocked to see some of the negative reviews because I go here weekly for the past several years -- food is always prompt, hot, and yummy. Service is the best of any RR in the area and most other places in OR in general. Never had a bad experience here. 4 of 5 stars is about right. Great food and great prices. I use 5 stars for restaurants that are beyond spectacular so this is actually a top rating.
Try the blue ribbon with very crispy bacon and the grill jalapeño on top!! Mmmmmm.... Delicious.

I am so disappointed with the RR on 188th Ave in Hillsboro Oregon. We ordered a kids Rad burger for our son. He likes it plain, dry and NO CHEESE. So we get home and open the box and what do we find? CHEESE! We had to pick off all the cheese only for our son to just pick at the burger. We are exhausted from travels and just wanted something quick for dinner. Thanks a lot RR for wasting our time by getting a quick dinner that our kid won't eat.

I used to be more of a Red Robin fan, but not as much anymore. The restaurant is redesigned. They are trying to go modern, but I like how they were before. Now they charge you if you order fries before your food comes even though they are bottomless. Prices are also way higher than they used to be. They still make some good things.

Red Robin used to be a great place place.  I frequently took the family for good meals at good prices with good service.  Not anymore. They recently remodeled their image inside and outside, but what came along with it is a remodeled management mentality which in my opinion is not in favor of the customer.  The focus now is on how fast they can turn tables, and how much they can get away with on price increases & portion size decreases.  The last four times I dined here, I had to ask for refills on the 'bottomless fries' and drinks, the wait staff never offered.  (Asking me "How's everything tasting?" does not suffice - I should not have to ask for refills I should be ASKED if I want refills.)  A bit about the food quality decline over the past half year:  Twice the kid's corn dogs were not cooked all the way, they still had wet uncooked dough and a cold hot dog inside.  Once child's portion of pasta arrived with 10 (yes, count 'em, TEN) noodles and about a tablespoon of red sauce. We never ordered that again.  In general, I can get far better $10-12+ burgers in terms of taste, size, value, and service at any number of places nearby, and they'll come served ON A PLATE, not in a cheap basket or plastic tray wrapped in a paper wrapper.  And twice, the patty melts, ordered "no pink" arrived raw inside, and they are now about 2/3 the size they were a year ago.  By the way, patty melts have been around for about a hundred years & the standard recipe across the country is for them to contain Swiss cheese (so why do Red Robin patty melts arrive with American cheese if I forget to tell the waiter to make sure there is Swiss cheese in it?). And a patty melt is supposed to be grilled & toasty-crisp on the outside of the grilled rye bread, not soggy wet on the bottom side.  I then have to choose to eat what is delivered, or wait for 10 minutes for the waiter to return to ask everyone but me at the table "How's everything tasting, awesome?" and then disappearing before anyone has a chance to clear the bite of food from their mouths to form a reply.  Then there's the prices overall, which are inflated to compensate for the overdone bar scene remodeling & the next thing, which I will refer to as "the final straw."  The final straw is that they have recently deployed obnoxious "Ziosk" touchscreen devices at all the tables.  They claim these things are to improve the customer experience, but based on  the research I did on them, they are really designed to do 3 things: reduce the waitstaff/customer interaction time, turn tables faster & get your kids to nag you to pay for video games (precisely the first thing my kid's discovered and promptly engaged with.)  Now, this may be an outdated concept, but I take my family out for a meal to enjoy time interacting with my family, eat good food, and get good service.  That Ziosk thing, on the other hand, takes up space on the table, reduces the quality of the family time, and does nothing to improve the food or the service.  I expressed to the waitress my dissatisfaction about having to use it, and the waitress assured me I did not need to use it.  Then she proceeded to figure out how enter out drink orders on it right in front of us.  When it soon came time to pay for the meal, I handed my rewards card & credit card to the waitress & again stated I did not want to use the Ziosk device.  She instead dismissed me with some comments to the effect of how easy and fun it is, and instructed me how to navigate the menu & swipe my rewards card and my credit card into the beast, which promptly and conveniently presented a tip suggestion of 20%.  Then she hovered about the table as if waiting to see what I'd do for the tip.  To sum it up, if this is the new Red Robin, it is no longer a place I want to go.

The past three times I've tried to go to the location and it's been nothing but disappointments. One hostess practically forced us to sit in the bar when there were plenty of booths open on the main floor (this has happened all three times) and then when we asked for a booth she said there weren't any available and put us in this tiny table when there were plenty of other table/booths open. Both times my mom ordered there deep fried shrimp and they over cooked it, and the make my salad with out hard boiled eggs and when I asked where they were they said they were "out of eggs" so then why wouldn't you tell me that when I ordered it? Not please at all

Surprisingly great Mac and cheese. Far better then I would expect from a burger place.  Great burgers and nice remodel make it fresh.  They have installed tablet like devices on each table that have games, the ability to order appetizers and also to pay your bill. I find it impersonal and it takes away from the servers job.  Let's keep it old school and keep interacting with humans!

Red Robin is a childhood love of mine, so to see it everywhere is comme ci comme ça. This location maintains a higher standard than any Red Robin I have been in, and Red Robin is such a tradition. The original location isn't around anymore, but the quality is improved and expanded here. Great Red Robin location!!! Wish I knew the staffs names to commend them, I believe we met a manager and had a fantastic server (best drink refiller ever) but I don't want to be weird and call people out... Anyway, having been to a bajillion Red Robins, this one is a good one.

I used to really like RedRobin.  It was my go-to place for a good burger and fries.  Lately, however, they have reverted to the ole "shrinkage" trick...I guess they think we won't notice and we will fill up on the bottomless french fries.  Last time I was there, I got my usual Whiskey Chicken Burger and realized the chicken patty is no longer the thick, juicy, delicious kind.  It's about 1/2 the size it used to be.. all flattened out and looks processed.  Again, they load on the shoe string onion rings (about twice the thickness of the chicken) and think we won't notice.  Sorry Red Robin.. your customers have caught on.  $11 for a chicken burger just isn't worth it.

Oh conflicting feelings! There was a time when I would have rated Red Robin 5 stars...but maybe that's because I was youthful and loved any kind of burger and all-you-can-eat fries I could find. Red Robin for me is a place of fun and nostalgia. I will always have a sense of loyalty to this place, as I've enjoyed many birthday celebrations, post-event desserts, dates, and hangouts at this 'other happiest place on earth.' However, recently, I've been a bit disappointed with the direction Red Robin is going. Before I get into my concerns, however, let me highlight the positives: 1) They have the best chicken strips I've ever had. I once tried every burger on the menu, but now I almost exclusively order their chicken strips. They are so cripsy, yet shatter and dissolve in your mouth as you bite into them. It's a sensation you just can't experience anywhere else. 2) The Red Robin seasoning salt! It's a must on all fries 3) Their sweet and spicy ketchup! and their campfire sauce! I usually try 4-5 different sauces whenever I go Concerns:  Ok, so in the last couple of years, RR seems to be making some changes to they way they do things. They no longer serve baskets of fries with their meals (they still use baskets when they bring out additional orders of bottomless). Now they stack their fries in a fancy chrome cup thing. It's supposed to look nicer, but I'm on to your game, RR...you're just serving out fewer fries. The portion isn't perceived to be decreased since it's all stacked up nicely in the small chrome cup. Just give me back that basket of fries you used to bring out. Also, biggest beef I have with Red Robin is that they no longer wrap their burgers when they serve them to you. They now come out on 'fancy' plates without any wrapper. The problem is that their burgers are not the easiest to eat, and now my burgers always fall apart half-way through eating them. I would love for them to sacrifice their 'new look' to go back to convenience and comfort and wrap their burgers again, and serve them in the basket of fries!

Just ridiculous. Red Robins use to be a place where $10 could get you full and the meal was great. Plus, who couldn't deny the bottomless fries? Now, all proportions are cut down like CRAZY and the fries come out in some sort of a cup. Their failed attempt to make it look "fancy" is really just an excuse to cut down on proportions. Well Juan, can't you just ask for more fries since their bottomless? Yes you can! Just expect to be greeted with an upset face, a 15 min wait, and 5 tasty fries for your consumption! Very sad :(

Red Robin says gourmet burgers in their name but this may be a bit of a stretch. They're certainly good but not the best I've ever had. Red Robin is a solid option if I am interested in a nicer lunch during my work day. Most of the time the service is impeccable. There are a few waiters / waitresses that are excellent at their jobs and it's always a pleasure when one of them is taking care of you. Sometimes it can be difficult to get additional fries for the bottomless fries in a timely manner. Also, it seems a little counter intuitive that a bigger portion is brought for the refill than the original. It's not my favorite option, but when I want to go someplace that is more of a sit down feel than normal, this fits the bill. They have started to put screens on each table that you can play trivia and pay your bill on. The paying your bill when you're ready is convenient but I don't like having a screen flashing at me while I am eating. Don't we have enough of that without it being incorporated into the dining experience? 3 stars.

Oh the holiday madness. I for one, love the holidays. I just don't love the panic that goes with the season. And since I live near, and work in, a prime shopping area, I have to suffer everyone else's madness. So, today, after a long day of retail and hospitality and traffic, we headed to Red Robin for basketball, french fries, and serenity. We found it. The service was good, the food was good (Whiskey River burger is always a winner!). We had ample drink/fry refills and just a generally peaceful, pleasant experience.

Great place for children! They were really crowded and had to wait 15 min for a table but it was worth it. They have a huge chalkboard for kids to draw on and a large balloon display for them to take as well. Kids menu has big variety of fun options such as chicken skewers and meatballs. All sides are bottomless, includes a beverage, and coloring paper. Only complaint is that we waited for about 30 minutes to get our beverages and the food came before the drinks. Our son was not a happy camper after being thirsty for so long. Other than that everything was as expected of a burger place.

Grr (insert SUPER angry face here)!!!  What's up with their new tablets at every table? When did it ever have a "do you wish to buy this game" option??? Wait... It DIDN'T!!!  We looked at the game for one second and yet at the end of our meal it charged us a fee. Umm... Nope, not going to pay for that! Well, ok, it was paid for BUT only because I didn't pay and a certain someone (aka my mother lol) didn't want to argue about it. I don't understand... PERHAPS, this is how Red Robin is going to make more money...  All I know is that next time I'm going to avoid that stupid thing like the plague! If it wasn't for those scrumptious fries and strawberry lemonade, I wouldn't go altogether!

Great friendly and fast service. I always get the same food at Red Robin which is the Banzai burger on an onion bun. The garlic herb fries are 99 cents extra and used to come with garlic butter (way way better) but now they only have the herb seasoning with parmesan. The price of the freckled lemonade has slowly been increasing, so make sure you ask for a cup to-go to get your money's worth!!

I used to love Red Robin! The food, the service, the atmosphere... All great! Since they have done the remodel and "modernized" the place, all of the things I used to love, are gone. The chairs slide all over the place, while you're trying to sit at the tables. The atmosphere sucks, because there are so many people crammed in a tight space. Other than one waitress, the service has gone to crap! I don't know if there is a disconnect between the wait staff and the kitchen staff, but our orders are always getting screwed up. I hate that I have to give a place that I grew up loving, such a bad rating.

Here comes an asian-y review of American place.  Awesome burger! I tried the whiskey river burger and it was a boom. Juicy flavor from the meat to the perfection mix of vegetables and cheese--just awesome.  Bottomless fries were crazy! Fries were insanely good, the sweet spicy thai chilies sauce (I totally made that name up) was a MUST for fries, it costed $.75 but come on, it's totally worth it!  Hawaiian smoothie was fascinating.

The burgers at good, but overall dissapointing. Red Robin is always busy, I've never seen it empty  so I'm sure you can afford to not water down the ranch dressing. Second, if somebody wants to drink what's on your "guest tap" for beer you should damned well tell them if you're charging $8 per pint!

Oh my we love the burgers here. And the unlimited steak fries :D. We frequently go to the other Red Robin's in the area too. Staff is always friendly and quick to get our steak fries refill. Must try gourmet burgers.
Good food and friendly staff.  Erica is our waitress and does a fantastic job.  The facility is well kept.  Definitely a good overall experience.

Worst service ever!We were at our table for ten minutes before someone noticed us. She came by to drop off silver ware and tell us another waitress was coming to take our drink orders! We waited another 2 minutes and took off!12 minutes of waiting to just get silverware!!! Really!!! We were a party of 5 and right next to us was a party of 5 with a child and they got seated the same time as we did! They were somehow able to get drinks! It wasn't even a packed house for a Sunday so we don't understand what the problem was. We were too angry and hungry to bother to find out so we left without speaking to the manager!!!  Another thing about the servers, I was sitting in a weirdly located table and was hit twice by two serves who looked back but didn't apologize for hitting my chair/ me. It was rude and upsetting as I have fibromyalgia and I'm sensitive to being touched.  This will not discourage us from going to Red Robin, it will just discourage us from going on during that time. (Maybe)

Pretty darn busy on a Saturday night. Service was good, the little tablets on the tables were pretty neat. The food was mediocre but Not horrible, wasn't expecting a whole lot. Might be back in a year or 2. Who knows.

8 out of 10 times I come here I'm disappointed the only reason I drag myself back is for the kids.  For some reason she likes it, but I swear the only thing separating theses places from McDonald's is a drive through window. Both have heat lamp food. My chicken bruschetta I'm willing to bet the farm it was sitting in widow for a while bread soggy chicken luke warm $10.99 wtf!

I do not like the "New" Red Robin.  I miss the old ways... Servers we have had recently had either been pretentious or rude and not even offering refills on "bottomless" fries and drinks... We were not even crazy or cheap we each ordered meals!   I had to hunt down our server for our check.. I might try them once more but it will be a while...

Good selection of Burgers and Drinks. Some of the new Burger items do stand out from the rest. I always have the sweet potato fries and they are happy to switch them for the regular fries. The option to pay at the table using the mini tablets is definitely helpful but does come with the challenge of keeping kids away from them since any games that they explore may get charged to the bill (found that out the hard way).

I've been coming to this location for as long as I can remember, this place had a offered a great environment with really cool decor. Very recently, they went through some redecorating, and all it did was get better. The food has stayed great, I for one love the Royal, which comes with an egg. Their freckled (strawberry) lemonade is exceptional. The wait times are never that bad on a normal night, and the service is always friendly. I would definitely recommend this resteraunt.
Food was great, clean and friendly. Our waitress made sure are drinks are filled... We were not forgotten

I had the whiskey river BBQ burger, and it was the best burger I've ever tasted. The kids' meals were far too large for our children; we just ordered one kids' meal and let them split it. Our server was friendly, quick, efficient, and didn't bother us while we were eating. (He got the kids' order out pronto, so they wouldn't have to wait as long we adults did.) The restaurant was clean and uniquely decorated. A manager walked the dining room occasionally, checking in on the customers and servers instead of staying out of sight. The only downsides are: (1) it's a bit on the pricey side, and (2) the electronic payment tablet on every table. Don't misunderstand; I do like having those tablets at the table. It means I can pay when I'm ready, instead of handing off my card to get yet another lengthy receipt that I have to do math on. It emailed me the receipt instantly. But the tablets make it way too easy to order a game, which is automatically added to your bill if a kid reaches out and taps the screen while you're not looking. Also it takes up space -- perhaps they can come up with a way to make them fold down under the table.

Even though they don't have croutons (like what the heck?) and charge extra for $2 for more guac on a five dollar chips appetizer that comes with a tiny little container of it.... it was the best Red Robin I've eaten at and we got our food in a timely matter despite how busy it was+ they have bad ass decor of little hamburger chairs and crayon art.
They have good attentive service, ioe any red robin their happy hour appetizer selection is pretty awesome. Got boneless wings and a mini salad for 8 dollars!
Great service but the food was not so great. How do you mess up a chicken salad?? Cold and not very tasty

The Red Robin chain in general has gone downhill fast in the last couple of years.  The effort to modernize and make it more of an industrial-chic presentation of food and restaurant has gotten the restaurant away from what it was good at - hamburgers and fries. Today's experience was probably the last straw.  We went in and were sat down pretty quickly.  You ever sit at a table and feel like the waitresses dont know who's responsible for the table?  That was tonight.  It took 10 minutes to get just drinks.  Okay they were what I would define as mildly busy, but in general the waitress seemed to just be going through the motions.  Got our waters pretty quickly. Another 15 minutes had gone buy and the waitress had still not come to take our food order.  She finally walks over and we place our order.  About 5 minutes later the table next to us places their order.   20 minutes later the food came out for the table next to us.  Then about 5 minutes later our food came out.  The person who must have been a manager who dropped off our food asked if we needed something.  I asked for BBQ sauce.  After about 5 minutes with the way things had gone I figured it was not coming so just ate.  Sure enough by the time I finished no BBQ sauce. Wife's salad was warm, my burger was only warm, and fries were on the cold side. We got one final "do you want any more fries" and I didnt want to wait any longer so I said no.  Within 3 minutes we were brought our check. Heres the best part - we didnt even have to pay with the waitress.  If you havent been there in a while the stands with the screens where you can order your appetizers, desserts, etc, well that was more of a waitress today than the actual waitress.  She brought water, someone else brought food, and alas, a very poor experience. For not even being the best burger in town (see: Helvetia Tavern, Cruise-in country diner) you are losing out on the only thing you have going for you, and thats an experience and customer service.  Will likely never return.

Every was friendly enough, but my turkey burger was over seasoned. If my order has not been a carry out, I would have sent it back. The fries were warm and good as every other Red Robin I've been too.

Atmosphere: The place was so busy when we arrived - probably because everyone is still on that holiday vacation. There were a lot of people crowding the entrance waiting for their names to be called. We put in our name, and we were quoted a 20-25 minute wait. We decided to wait, and we were called in about 15 minutes. The floor under our table was a bit dirty, and I wished they had cleaned it a bit (i.e. napkins, crayons, etc.). Server: He was great. He was lively, and he made light, polite conversation. This is surprising given how incredibly busy the place was. We got our drinks and food in a timely manner, and we were asked if we wanted more of our sides; of course I want more fries! Is that even a question? Lol.  Food: It was good. I am the type that orders, like, one of three things all the time, and for some reason, my food totally hit a spot that I totally had no idea needed hitting. I ordered a turkey burger. You wouldn't normally think juicy with a turkey burger, but it definitely was.
Cold food that should have been hot and hot food that should have been cold when delivered by poor wait staff. Definitely not the best Red Robin around.

I have been here twice by now. First time was my first time in red robin, and I loved this place.  We had very unpleasant experience with red robin at Federal way, WA location. So my wife was  a little hesitant to visit red robin altogether. But this place changed her mind, and she now looks forward to visit red robin again. We visited on a Sunday evening, rather rush hour. But we got a table within minutes. Our server Rubin was really nice. We got exactly as we ordered.  One thing is usual about red robin is, you end up waiting for bottomless fries.  But you can ignore that because of tasty burger. And good thing, you can make any burger a vegetarian burger. And change sauce as per your taste. That makes it a really vegetarian friendly place.

I think Red Robin in general is overpriced for what you get. I don't find the menu to be that unique and the portions are small for the price. Honestly, if your main menu item is burgers you really need something to make you stand out and Red Robin just doesn't have that.

I give them 1 star because there is no 0 stars. Horrible service. Waited 15 minutes just to order drinks and the waiter showed up with an attitude. Never coming back here. People sitting behind us were waiting for fries for as long as we were. I guess the horrible service runs all the way from California to Portland. It's just in their manual!!!!

Yesterday my buddy ed his wife and two kids went to this location right at opening. When the waitress sat the table it was very dirty. The next booth has tons of garbage all around the floor and underneath. For just opening you would think the place would be clean. Makes you wonder if the kitchen of the restaurant is even remotely clean. Not very happy about this.

Today my wife and I came in for a burger around 4:30. Walked in and told it be a 5 min wait, we looked at each other and there was over 22 tables not being used. They tried to sit us at a very small table that should be used by a single person. I told her nope not here, so we got seated where the waiters and waitress bring you your water and place your order. It was very noise, hard to hear my wife. The cool part is how you pay you bill, it was easy .

This was the worst experience that my family and I have ever had. The waiter was completely rude. The management just gave excuses for his team that he obviously couldn't manage. Instead of management talking over they let us almost walk out! The other employees thought it was funny to be treated badly. This place should be shut down until they do a overhaul on the staff. The young people bring in a new flare but can be also damaging to the business. Management sat us down with a waitress that was more a veteran and she was awesome until Management didn't communicate to her that the meal was on him. So when she asked us to pay she didn't believe us she went to ask and came back with a different attitude. Management never came back by us to see if the service was any better. When leaving I asked for his manager's bosses card he gave me a bad attitude and said why you know her already. My family and I will not be back and I will make sure that others know how bad of a establishment this is!!

Red Robin has been a staple in my eating out tendencies for a while now. The bottomless fries and strawberry lemonade is hard to beat. I will admit this place is a guilty pleasure of mine especially when I am dieting. The chicken Cesar salad here is awesome as well. I know it sounds boring but they cook the chicken to just the right texture. Staff was friendly to my girlfriend and I as well. Now to find me the spice they use on those fries.

Usually we have gotten decent service and food here . Tonight was a different story. I ordered a a bacon guacamole burger that came minus the bacon. The service was slow even though it wasn't very busy at all .Our server never bothered to ask if our food was okay or if we needed anything else,as a matter of fact he only returned twice to remove plates from our table.

This is a long one, but I feel like it's needed we've been to Red Robin plenty of times, and we've always had decent service but we hadn't been in a long time.  Last weekend we went here, and sat in the bar because the regular dinning area was so busy. We were given a gift card by a family member and us d it for a nice dinner and movie night out. But that's about where the nice stops. I even waited a few days to make sure I wanted to say something about our experience and what I wanted to say.  Our waiter from the start was condescending and rude. when we asked it'd it was open seating in the bar,  he said yeah and rolled his eyes.  We asked for a few moments before ordering because we weren't sure what we wanted right when we sat down. When he came back he asked if we "were ready to start making some decisions," and not in a nice way. We ordered, thinking maybe it was just a one off thing, and it was loud in the restaurant and we had to ask him to repeat a few things and each time his tone was terrible. I really don't know why we stayed except that we were both really hungry and this gift card had to be used sometime.  We asked for fries while we waited and our waiter walked away. Flash to 20 minutes later to no fries, no food, no water, but he made sure our bar drinks were delivered. Every time we saw him he was talking to other staff members or leaning against the counter. Our food finally came, and we asked the person who brought the food for more fries because we had about 5 on the plate. She was very nice and said she would let our server know. We ate our food (don't even consider the French onion soup) and were looking out for the fries. No fries, and no waiter, and still no water. While eating we had witnessed our waiter chewing out another waiter for taking the order on the table next to us. Talk about awkward.  Then being pretty fed up at having to ask a fourth time for some help, one of us went to the host stand to talk to a manager about what was happening. Suddenly fries appeared, and the "manager" bearing a free $3-5 appetizer coupon, saying this is for "when things like this happen." Pretty much the rock bottom minimum. Then, our waiter comes back and delivers our check clapping my husband on the shoulder, and asking us fill out the survey "because I need good marks," I can see why and we made sure to fill out that survey. I have contacted the chain about our experience, with both our waiter and the manager, as it was completely unacceptable, and we will not be back even if we receive another gift card

Although the wait time on a Saturday night at 6:30 was half an hour, by the time we got seated, the food came out perfect and fast! Had a great waiter tonight who put up with our endless requests for drink, fries, broccoli and even kids Mac and cheese refills constantly. There are few restaurants who go out of their way to accommodate guests whims, Red Robin does it exceptionally!  Paleo or gluten free? Order your burger lettuce wrapped and order unlimited steamed broccoli or side salad!  You can swap out toppings and cheese. Love that the kids meals around $5 each come with drinks (I hate paying for kids drinks) and unlimited fries.  Hint: order a free basket of fries as your appetizer!  Free campfire sauce is amazing! My go to favorite is the teriyaki chicken sandwich!  Register for the Rewards and get free burger on your bday (along with a cheesy song and a free sundae)! Buy 9 items and get the 10th free.  By far, this Tanasborne location is consistently better food and service than the Beaverton one.  One star lost because they don't take reservations, and for an uber friendly family restaurant that's hard with kids in tow, and the chicken on my husband's salad was super cold by the time it came to the table. And the atmosphere is so loud...so loud in fact that my mom can't come here anymore since she can't hear.  I actually like that you can pay at the table with the tablets. Downside...$2 to play so unless you're desperate to shut the kids up...don't let them touch it!
Bottomless fries but you never get the or they bring a basket of 6 fries for three large men.  Doc pepper tasted off.  Better burger in the area for less.

Fun place, great milkshakes. They offer the smaller shake which is great if you don't want a giant milkshake. Their southern charm burger is delicious, and of course their fries are the best ever. Nice staff and clean restaurant.

Service is very very slow. No beverage refill after asking for one. Another staff member happened by table and asked finally if we were ok after 15 minutes.  Asked again for our refills.  That person left and 5 minutes later the waitress who was supposed to have gotten our refill originally made a special trip finally to advise that we could not get another refill because they were closing.  How tacky and classless. The refills were pop, not alcohol. Is it my fault I had to wait 20 minutes plus for a refill?  Terrible service.  I don't know how red Robin is profitable.  Maybe charging for imaginary beverages?  I wonder if I could have a refill of water.  So disappointed and irritated. My review reflected my tip to the waitress.  My tip to you, go to Burgerville. Service there is world class compared to Red Robin.

Stopped for lunch late Friday afternoon and ate in the bar. Service was good.  I have celiac so I appreciated the fact that RR has a rather extensive Gluten friendly menu. But, you do need to check your order. My burger, which was ordered off the GF menu came with deep fried jalapeño coins which are not GF. They were quick to correct with a new burger.  My big complaint about their GF bun, this is not unique to RR, is that the GF bun was significantly smaller than the burger patty making it hard to eat the burger. They also charge $1 for the GF bun. This seems to be a trend at many restaurants. Chick-fil-a across the street also charges an extra dollar.  They have a second deep fryer for French fries only so there is no cross contamination with the breaded deep fried foods. My complaint about their fries is that I like my fries on the crisp side and they do not cook the fries long enough to become crisp.  Overall RR was a good choice. They may not have the best burger and fries in town but it's consistently decent.

The best place about this Red Robin was Emily who was our server in the bar area.  She had such a great sense of humor and took on the challenge of getting as good as she got with my husband...all in fun and she made our experience there great!!

If I could give 0 stars I would. My husband had a 4" spatula handle in his burger. How this happens I have no idea but he bit in to his burger and found the broken handle of a white spatula about a 4" piece. If the kitchen and staff can't catch this then what else in in the food, in addition there was not offer to comp the meal. Luckily he was not injured but serious negligence could have caused serious injury. As a side note - though not the reason for my review...dogs are also not allowed on the patio here. After having brought my well behaved dog here multiple times in the past we were kicked off the patio after letting the hostess know we wanted outside seating because we had a dog...with the manager saying they are not allowed and never were. Even the staff doesn't know they aren't allowed. Take your business elsewhere.

never been a huge fan, but this particular day, we had a great time...stopped for lunch after picking up someone at the airport, service was great, got a very nice chicken tender salad...Price was comparable to similar places...If ever back this way, I'd come back
Good food as usual. Server was awesome, very attentive and answered all questions! We had the berry ice cream cake for dessert and it was worth it!

My waiter had a black eye. I was also tricked by the new waiter they put on your table, you know, the screen that thinks it should be tipped? "Hey buddy! You look bored, why don't you accidentally touch my screen so I can charge you for a bejeweled ripoff?" So I do, then angrily turn the screen away so I don't get tricked again. The black-eye waiter appears out of nowhere and turns the screen back around. Something fishy is going on here...

This is an updated review after our first negative review.  We went back to this location and were pleasantly surprised. We ordered take out again. We sat in the waiting area for maybe 10 minutes. They brought us a small side of fries to apologize for the long wait. That was not necessary but much appreciated as we had a 1 year old getting restless. After we got our food we were happy this time with the quantity of fries and extra ranches. Everything was as expected and tasted great.
Red Robin is now serving serving slices and tiny bits of mushroom as the appetizer instead of full mushrooms. It's so odd. They seem to be struggling at this location as of late.

Never was even seated. Arrived and waited for someone to come and seat us (3 people). Checked out the bar no tables large enough for 3 people to sit together. Went back to seating area, filled with people waiting, said "forget it" and left. Will not be back any time soon.
Robbie was so awesome helping me with my to-go order today.  The best service and sincere service I've received at this location!  Will definitely be placing more orders from now on!!!!

I hate leaving bad reviews... So I'll keep this short. Pro: -They make a solid burger. -Bottomless fries (be sure to get the dipping sauces.  They're great!). -Consistent quality. Cons: -Long wait to get seated... But hey, it was busy... You can't really hold that against a business. -Slow service.  I'm not sure if someone (or multiple people) called in sick... But it took forever to get served.  Even after being served, our party of 6 barely got checked up on... And even then, it took ages to get anything. -We got charged for using their tablet entertained... Even though we didn't use it.... Fighting over a $1.99 fee wasn't worth the hassle, so just paid it. All in all... I would recommend RR... Just not this one.

Don't come here for lunch!  I came  in for a lunch meeting today. I seriously waited 5 minutes for the hostess and another worker to stop flirting before they even acknowledged me. Then she -Kaori-left for a while and other customers were waiting around to get seated and the entire front area was full. This generation of workers are clueless on customer service and need to be trained.  The floor was so gross I was slipping and it wasn't the rain. I showed the hostess and she ignored us.  Took 30 minutes to get a salad and soup.

Well, just like the Outback Steakhouse this place has gone downhill. The food isn't necessarily worse but the staff and how the place is managed is unprofessional, slow and they make a lot of mistakes with orders. We sat at the bar for about 1 hour because the dining room was just in chaos. We watched as people came in for their to-go orders and saw one guy have to return his order twice to get it right. Not uncommon to see most orders returned at least once. They're not afraid to charge a lot of money for food. Service from the kitchen is very slow so don't come in if you need a timely meal.
