Honestly...Red Robin isn't my 1st, or even 6th choice as a alternative dining location. I have had multiple unsatisfactory visits. Tonight this decision was made for me so i figured the heck. Sadly, the result was the same. We had a party of 6. For starters, it took close to 35 minutes for us to get our food. Our server made several excuses during our visit. She didn't pay attention to our party as she should have, got several of our requests wrong, and clearly didn't put our order in a reasonable time. I don't like it when people make excuses when their people they are trying to help don't want to hear it.  Anyway on to the food. We ordered a kids pizza with sausage (no cheese) for my son who is lactose intolerant. "Interesting Choice" our server said. Of course it was served with cheese..My wife got a Burning Love burger. Requested medium rare and came not close to that. Also there were supposed to be fried jalapenos and there were just fried nuggets. I got the Smokey Pepper burger...not to Smokey and not too peppery. Thankfully it was served medium rare as i ordered, but there were just two sad pieces of bacon (not peppered as advertised)  Anyway the store manager did come over and acknowledge all of the missteps. Not sure what the final resolution was seeing as i had to leave early to take my son home.

I really don't get what's happened to this place. Red Robin as a brand is great but the Tanasbourne location seriously stinks. We have given the place at least 10 chances. We live nearby but won't be back again. We will go into Beaverton instead. Short story: greasy old stale fries, lemonade passing as margaritas, dirty tables, silverware and spotty service. There are a few good servers but they can't fix the food.

To go side is unorganized. Arrived around my scheduled pickup time. 5 minutes later it's not ready. 2 GrubHub drivers came after and got their orders immediately. I asked again and 20 minutes after my scheduled pick-up time they said they forgot my name and that I was there to pick up a to go order

First of all let me say that I am definitely not one to review nor am I one to complain but this has definitely caused some frustration.  For the last 10 years I have always thrown a Christmas party for my employees. This year we chose to go to Red Robin near Hillsboro as we typically go to the one near Mall 205 in pdx. I called two locations, the one on TV highway and the one near 185th letting them know that I would like to host my Christmas party there, I do not need a banquet room I just need to make sure they have enough tables and chairs for my employees to have a good time. I also let them know that I would be putting this on my corporate credit card and that this tab ranges anywhere between $1000-$2000 for this type of event. (They will not make that much money in 1.5 any other way). The first location I called which was the TV highway location gave me a definite no and told me that they were not able to accommodate my request. ONE MONTH IN ADVANCE!! I did express to that manager (Sherri) that that seemed to be poor business and that I could not understand how any business with decline this amount of customers and a paid tab. I asked to speak to her manager. I left my number for a call back.  I then called the location on 188th and asked to speak with the manager Julie unfortunately Julie was not available as she is on vacation so I ended up speaking with the gentleman who was the manager of the kitchen named Pallino. Pallino told me the same thing Sherri from the other location told me and that was that they were not able to accommodate my request because of the hours indicated 5:30pm. I then asked to speak with his general manager and that is when he told me her name was Leanne stein. I called Leanne and left a detailed message and asked for a call back. I revived a calla round 40 mins later from Leanne.  So here it goes.... I cannot express enough the amount of unprofessionalism and lack of customer service that I have received from the general manager Leanne Stein. I am appalled that this restaurant would decline a party of 30 people because it was during their peek hours even though I called to to inform them a month in advance that I would be bring my staff to this location on 12/22/17 arriving at 5:30pm and would be done within 1.5hrs.  I was told they will not accommodate me and my employees as they will loose money on a number of tables that are not able to be turned over because of my large party. She tried to break it down to me in a way that felt was very condescending and not needed, she stated she would need six tables in order to accommodate my party and that's too many to lose money on. There is no way that they are going to make in between $1000 and $2000 within an hour and a half no matter how many people they see. This is guaranteed payment!!! I asked if I could speak with her manager she said she did not have one I asked her where the corporate office was located she told me Denver Colorado she also told me that I could escalate this as far as I want but it will end up back on her desk as she is the regional general manager for this area. Her uncalled for comment about escalating this issue is why I am writing this review because I felt she was unprofessional and felt as if she felt she was the "Person in charge" of customer issues or complaints which I know is not the case.  I feel she should have done something to accommodate my large party and since I am not getting a call back from the corporate office I decided the only way for my concern to be seen is to leave a review on each location.  Thanks!
Order to go and after a 40 min wait, my food was completely cold and limp. I get it's a busy day but paying for cold food sucks

Ordered online many times, they never have the order ready on time. Tonight it's very busy...I understand. But if you give me a pickup time it's not ok if I have to wait over 30min....and I'm still standing here without my order. Definitely not recommended for take-away orders! Ok, was about to leave but got my order after 45min. and guess what...not many fries (ordered extra fries) and Burgers and Fries were almost cold. Wife + Kids were not happy in the car as well.  DON'T go to this RR!
Slow service. I waited 10 minutes to receive the order I placed to go over the phone. And also waited 15 minutes to receive my change.
I have ordered from them through Grub Hub, from this loation. They have messed up my order twice and lied both times when contacted.

Until now, I've never had a bad experience at a Red Robin. I'll never go back to this particular one. My partner and I sat in the bar, and while it took a long time for the server to get our order, that was no big deal. I had the Caesar salad and my partner had one of the fancy burgers. Or, I should say...those are what we ordered. To say we had them would imply that we ate them beyond a few bites. The server explained that they were out of romaine and could make the Caesar with iceberg lettuce, and I said sure, not a big deal. An abnormal amount of time later, the server brought dinner. My partner's fries were lukewarm (normally RR fries are too hot to handle when first served), and her burger was chilly. As for mine, I had a bowl of limp, flat, warm, browning iceberg lettuce with a particularly bland dressing and some strips of medium warm chicken. Even adding more dressing didn't seem to add flavor. The 'toast' was in one case soggy, and in the other felt stale--neither piece was warm. My partner figured the stuff had sat under the heat lamp for a very long time; she may have been right. We aren't the type to be cruel to servers, but after picking at these disappointments for a few moments, we agreed we just didn't want to eat this. We told the server. He made the standard offers of restitution you'd expect of a capable waiter, and we opted to leave without finishing or paying. I don't think this was all his fault, though you'd think he'd notice a bed of browning, badly cut lettuce. Then the most disappointing thing happened, the one that showed us where the rot began. My partner asked to speak to the manager. You can tell when a manager is concerned, because s/he wants to have the conversation. This one did not. Oh, he apologized, but he didn't ask for any details; he seemed willing to hear out whatever we said, apologize however many times it took, but that was it. "Wanna gift card?" he asked, as if he gets such complaints a couple times an hour and is used to them. No, thanks, said my partner. I don't know what's wrong with this RR, but I have a pretty good idea it stems from lack of leadership. Now I'm not absolutely sure we feel comfortable visiting any others. If we want to spend that much for a hamburger, we can get much better ones in a much less obnoxious setting.

Burgers are basic and is nothing incredible. I only came here to use my Birthday meal deal, which is pretty much one of the few reasons I even come eating here to make the overall price worth it with my friends or family. I usually ask the fries to be well-done/crispy because I personally don't like thick cut fries.
